CSSAnimation-timelineView.summary: The view() CSS function can be used with animation-timeline to indicate a subject element that will provide an anonymous view progress timeline to animate. The view progress timeline is progressed through by a change in visibility of the subject element inside the nearest ancestor scroller. The visibility of the subject inside the scroller is tracked â€” by default, the timeline is at 0% when the subject is first visible at one edge of the scroller, and 100% when it reaches the opposite edge.

remarks.para: The function parameters can specify the scrollbar axis along which timeline progress will be tracked and an inset that adjusts the position of the box in which the subject is deemed to be visible.

blockquote.para: Note: If the indicated axis does not contain a scrollbar, then the animation timeline will be inactive (have zero progress).
Note: Each use of view() corresponds to its own unique instance of in the Web Animations API.
